messages.subject: Didn't make the team.
messages.msgSnippet: ... If there s a tag team, I wasn t invited to join. I know quite a few of the people on this list and have for a long time, including Lisa Bugg, whose post
messages.messageBody:
----------
>From: Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com
>To: Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com
>Subject: [Unschooling-dotcom] Digest Number 1484
>Date: Mon, Sep 17, 2001, 10:45 PM
>

> The difference is that on that "other list"
> people do NOT play tag team nor do they wait for the next opportunity to
> disect something said by the party they are bent out of shape at.

If there's a tag team, I wasn't invited to join. I know quite a few of the
people on this list and have for a long time, including Lisa Bugg, whose
post you quoted with the accusations above. If there were an organized group
doing this, I'm not bragging to say I'd be on Lisa's short list of people to
talk to about it. The fact is, Lisa is not that kind of person, so it's
moot.

When many people all disagree with someone's views, it isn't necessary to
choreograph. Honest reactions and opinions work just fine.

Pam
